WRITING.TITLE: Glitches in Weezer songs
WRITING.TEXT:
What are some minor studio foulups in Weezer songs that you know of?
For example, 3 seconds into "The World Has Turned and Left Me Here", you can hear a squeaking noise. Happens again about a second later, this time a bit longer.

The original comment is a real thing that happened (Coolidge was known for, despite his wit, keeping to himself and not saying much). The replies are just jokes imagining what else he could have said in this scenario.
Pretty funny that both of those were unrelated. #BadLuckNixon
I don't think there was meant to be a moral, it was probably just to show shit was gettin real

Speak for yourself, IMO Pinkerton wouldn't truly feel complete if Butterfly wasn't the closer. It addresses and ties up all of the themes from the previous songs and its bare instrumentation is the perfect contrast to the rest of the record. Longtime Sunshine is one of my favorite Weezer songs ever, but I definitely think it only works as a closer to SftBH. Tragic Girl should've just been on the album in general, it's a fantastic song but I don't see it as a closer.

I love Fall Together, it's one of the few songs on Maladroit where Rivers' attempts at meshing hard rock with the Weez actually fully comes together. Maladroit's worst for me is easily Space Rock. Generic instrumentation, terrible production, and godawful vocals. Probably one of the worst tracks to ever be on a Weezer album

It's not like the London killer wasn't born in England...

Sadiq Khan has said he believes the threat of terror attacks are part and parcel of living in a big city and encouraged Londoners to be vigilant to combat dangers.
The Mayor of London revealed he had a sleepless night after the recent bombing in New York, and said major cities around the world have got to be prepared for these sorts of things to happen when people least expect them.
Nothing is more important to me than keeping Londoners safe, Mr Khan said at the time. I want to be reassured that every single agency and individual involved in protecting our city has the resources and expertise they need to respond in the event that London is attacked.
The terrorists are evolving their tactics and we have got to evolve our response to them all the time. I am afraid the consequences of a terror attack are very very scary. They want to kill. They want to maim and terrify. It is my job to try to make sure that we are as safe as we can be.

Imo both EWBAITE and White were great, so it makes this new crappy song hurt just a tad more, because it seemed like they were slowly on their way back up to the top.
I'm not a big fan of Back to the Shack and I like EWBAITE. I don't like TGFG and I love White. I detest this new song so I guess that means I'll LOVE Black. That's how it works now, it seems.
After single #2

Space Jam has a wacky concept and executes it surprisingly well. I don't think it's a great movie but the fact that the production is fully competent for such a zany premise adds memorability. Back in Action though is pretty paint by numbers despite its live action/2D concept.

I'd say I like Seven More Minutes, but it's kinda inconsistent. The first three tracks are great. Then The Cruise hits and it's just pretty annoying and kills the vibe for a bit: Barcelona and Say Goodbye Forever are kinda fillery. I really like Overlee, but Big Daddy C is pretty grating. Keep Sleeping and The Man with Two Brains are both great but as the album hits the home stretch it kinda gets more and more susceptible to filler: I kinda tune out when it hits Must Be Wrong, Insomnia, and the It's Alright reprise. It does end on a high note though, I really like My Head is in the Sun and Jumping Around. Overall I'd say it's good but it doesn't really need to be an hour long; you could chop off a few tracks and it definitely would increase my rating. Lost in Alphaville is a lot better imo
